publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1517# Robert Brown: Landmark—That the Parliament notes with concern the circumstances of the closure of the Landmark branches in Easterhouse, Clydebank and Uddingston and others across Scotland; expresses sympathy for the customers and staff affected and calls for an urgent investigation into the affairs of Landmark and a review of the necessary legislation to protect customers against any loss of deposits when companies go out of business.
S1M-1517# Landmark (lodged on 10 January 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Alex Neil*, Shona Robison*

S1M-1517# Robert Brown: Landmark—That the Parliament notes with concern the circumstances of the closure of the Landmark branches in Easterhouse, Clydebank and Uddingston and others across Scotland; expresses sympathy for the customers and staff affected and calls for an urgent investigation into the affairs of Landmark and a review of the necessary legislation to protect customers against any loss of deposits when companies go out of business. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1517# Landmark (lodged on 10 January 2001) Fiona Hyslop*, Richard Lochhead*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1517# Landmark (lodged on 10 January 2001) Michael Russell*, Nora Radcliffe*, Scott Barrie*
S1M-1517# Landmark (lodged on 10 January 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*

S1M-1517# Robert Brown: Landmark—That the Parliament notes with concern the circumstances of the closure of the Landmark branches in Easterhouse, Clydebank and Uddingston and others across Scotland; expresses sympathy for the customers and staff affected and calls for an urgent investigation into the affairs of Landmark and a review of the necessary legislation to protect customers against any loss of deposits when companies go out of business. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Fiona McLeod, Fiona Hyslop, Richard Lochhead, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Scott Barrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder
S1M-1517# Landmark (lodged on 10 January 2001) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1517# Landmark (lodged on 10 January 2001) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1517# Landmark (lodged on 10 January 2001) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1517# Robert Brown: Landmark—That the Parliament notes with concern the circumstances of the closure of the Landmark branches in Easterhouse, Clydebank and Uddingston and others across Scotland; expresses sympathy for the customers and staff affected and calls for an urgent investigation into the affairs of Landmark and a review of the necessary legislation to protect customers against any loss of deposits when companies go out of business. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Fiona McLeod, Fiona Hyslop, Richard Lochhead, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Scott Barrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Donald Gorrie, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-1517# Landmark (lodged on 10 January 2001) Karen Gillon*
S1M-1517# Landmark (lodged on 10 January 2001) Mr John Home Robertson*

S1M-1517# Robert Brown: Landmark—That the Parliament notes with concern the circumstances of the closure of the Landmark branches in Easterhouse, Clydebank and Uddingston and others across Scotland; expresses sympathy for the customers and staff affected and calls for an urgent investigation into the affairs of Landmark and a review of the necessary legislation to protect customers against any loss of deposits when companies go out of business. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Fiona McLeod, Fiona Hyslop, Richard Lochhead, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Scott Barrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Donald Gorrie, Tommy Sheridan, Karen Gillon, Mr John Home Robertson
